thread.title: Astros blow big lead to let Royals back into ALDS | Sport
thread.title_full: Astros blow big lead to let Royals back into ALDS | Sport | The Guardian

author: Associated Press in Houston
title: Astros blow big lead to let Royals back into ALDS | Sport
text:
Astros shortstop Carlos Correa couldn’t handle a deflected grounder that might have been a double-play ball, helping the Kansas City Royals rally for five runs in the eighth inning to beat Houston 9-6 on Monday and force their playoff series to a decisive game five.
Correa homered twice, doubled, singled and drove in four runs in game four of the AL Division Series. Houston took a 6-2 lead into the eighth, but a tough error charged to the 21-year-old rookie keyed the Royals’ comeback to even the matchup at two games apiece.
The decider will be back in Kansas City on Wednesday night.
Late in the game, a tweet from the account of Texas Gov. Greg Abbott congratulated the Astros on advancing to the AL Championship Series. But the defending AL champion Royals had other ideas.
